snippet: Residents found ways to hide delicate artifacts from the Islamists who reigned over the city until last weekend, when fighters set fire to dozens of ancient manuscripts.
abstract: Residents of Timbuktu, Mali, have found ways to hide some delicate ancient artifacts and protect them from Islamist extremists in the city, but despite their efforts, dozens of ancient manuscripts and some tombs have been destroyed.

byline.contributor: Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Residents found ways to hide delicate artifacts from the Islamists who reigned over the city until last weekend, when fighters set fire to dozens of ancient manuscripts.

headline.seo: Saving Timbuktu’s Priceless Artifacts From Militants’ Clutches
headline.main: As Extremists Invaded, Timbuktu Hid Artifacts of a Golden Age
headline.print_headline: As Extremists Invaded, Timbuktu Hid Artifacts of a Golden Age
